paragraphs.text:
%md
# About This Exercise
**Title:** Load Data into Hive database cloudsale
**Objective:** 
        Copy data from local host to hdfs
        Load data into Hive database cloudsale staging tables
        Use Insert Table As Select to load data into Hive database cloudsale managed tables
**File locations:** 
        hostname:/var/data/clouddev
        hdfs:/tentant/cloudsale/data
**Successful outcome:** Managed hive database
**Before you begin:** N/A
**Related lessons:** Ranger

---

msg.data:
About This Exercise

Title: Load Data into Hive database cloudsale
Objective:

    Copy data from local host to hdfs
    Load data into Hive database cloudsale staging tables
    Use Insert Table As Select to load data into Hive database cloudsale managed tables

File locations:

    hostname:/var/data/clouddev
    hdfs:/tentant/cloudsale/data

Successful outcome: Managed hive database
Before you begin: N/A
Related lessons: Ranger

paragraphs.text:
%md

#### CDP Recommended Practice for Managed Databases

This exercise represents a CDP recommended practice for batch loading a Hive managed database where the 
data is encrypted with a KMS key and formatted as ORC data blocks. The data is encrypted as it is loaded into hdfs and 
remains encrypted as it is moved into an external staging table and then into a managed table. 
Rerun this processes to continuously load batch data into a Hive managed database.

msg.data:
CDP Recommended Practice for Managed Databases

This exercise represents a CDP recommended practice for batch loading a Hive managed database where the
data is encrypted with a KMS key and formatted as ORC data blocks. The data is encrypted as it is loaded into hdfs and
remains encrypted as it is moved into an external staging table and then into a managed table.
Rerun this processes to continuously load batch data into a Hive managed database.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Setup

paragraphs.title: 1 - Validate data engineer user
paragraphs.text:
%sh

echo 'BadPass@1' | su -l diego_deng -c "klist"

msg.data:
Password: Ticket cache: FILE:/tmp/krb5cc_213600006_tGnDLp
Default principal: diego_deng@EXAMPLE.COM

Valid starting       Expires              Service principal
04/03/2022 16:20:45  04/04/2022 16:20:45  krbtgt/EXAMPLE.COM@EXAMPLE.COM
	renew until 04/10/2022 16:20:45

paragraphs.text:
%md
#Exercise

%md

## Copy Data into HDFS

paragraphs.title: 2 - List the cloudsale dataset
paragraphs.text:
%sh

ls /var/data/cloudsale

paragraphs.title: 3 - Make tmp directory for cloudsale
paragraphs.text:
%sh

rm -r /tmp/cloudsale
mkdir /tmp/cloudsale

msg.data: rm: cannot remove ‘/tmp/cloudsale’: No such file or directory

paragraphs.title: 4 - Use tar to extract the gz files into /tmp/cloudsale
paragraphs.text:
%sh

tar -xvzf /var/data/cloudsale/consent_data.tar.gz -C /tmp/cloudsale/
tar -xvzf /var/data/cloudsale/eu_country.tar.gz -C /tmp/cloudsale/
tar -xvzf /var/data/cloudsale/us_customer.tar.gz -C /tmp/cloudsale/
tar -xvzf /var/data/cloudsale/ww_customer.tar.gz -C /tmp/cloudsale/

paragraphs.title: 5 - Delete existing data in hdfs data
paragraphs.text:
%sh

echo BadPass@1 | su - diego_deng -c "hdfs dfs -rm -skipTrash /tenant/cloudsale/data/*"

msg.data: Password: rm: `/tenant/cloudsale/data/*': No such file or directory

paragraphs.text:
%md

If not data exists this will result in an error. Continue.

msg.data: If not data exists this will result in an error. Continue.

paragraphs.title: 6 - Load datafiles into hdfs
paragraphs.text:
%sh

echo BadPass@1 | su - diego_deng -c "hdfs dfs -put /tmp/cloudsale/* /tenant/cloudsale/data/"
echo BadPass@1 | su - diego_deng -c "hdfs dfs -ls /tenant/cloudsale/data/"

msg.data:
Password: Password: Found 4 items
-rw-r--r--   3 diego_deng hive    3303028 2022-04-03 16:21 /tenant/cloudsale/data/consent_data.csv
-rw-r--r--   3 diego_deng hive        443 2022-04-03 16:21 /tenant/cloudsale/data/eu_country.csv
-rw-r--r--   3 diego_deng hive   17889080 2022-04-03 16:21 /tenant/cloudsale/data/us_customer.csv
-rw-r--r--   3 diego_deng hive   18240085 2022-04-03 16:21 /tenant/cloudsale/data/ww_customer.csv

paragraphs.text:
%md

## Load the Hive Stage Tables

paragraphs.title: 7 - Use cloudsale_stage
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

USE cloudsale_stage;

paragraphs.title: 8 - Load table cloudsale_stage.consent_data
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

LOAD DATA INPATH '/tenant/cloudsale/data/consent_data.csv' INTO TABLE cloudsale_stage.consent_data;

paragraphs.title: 9 - Load table cloudsale_stage.eu_country
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

LOAD DATA INPATH '/tenant/cloudsale/data/eu_country.csv' INTO TABLE cloudsale_stage.eu_country;

paragraphs.title: 10 - Load table cloudsale_stage.us_customer
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

LOAD DATA INPATH '/tenant/cloudsale/data/us_customer.csv' INTO TABLE cloudsale_stage.us_customer;

paragraphs.title: 11 - Load table cloudsale_stage.ww_customer
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

LOAD DATA INPATH '/tenant/cloudsale/data/ww_customer.csv' INTO TABLE cloudsale_stage.ww_customer;

%md

## Verify Stage Data

paragraphs.text:
%md

## Insert Data into Managed Tables

paragraphs.title: 14 - Insert data into cloudsale.consent_data
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

INSERT INTO TABLE cloudsale.consent_data SELECT * FROM cloudsale_stage.consent_data;

paragraphs.title: 15 - Insert data into cloudsale.eu_country
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

INSERT INTO TABLE cloudsale.eu_country SELECT * FROM cloudsale_stage.eu_country;

paragraphs.title: 16 - Insert data into cloudsale.us_customer
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

INSERT INTO TABLE cloudsale.us_customer SELECT * FROM cloudsale_stage.us_customer;

paragraphs.title: 17 - Insert data into cloudsale.ww_customer
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

INSERT INTO TABLE cloudsale.ww_customer SELECT * FROM cloudsale_stage.ww_customer;

%md

## Verify Managed Tables

paragraphs.title: 19 - Important Note on Truncate Staging Tables
paragraphs.text:
%md

By default in CDP, TRUNCATE TABLE is supported only on managed tables. Do not attempt to run TRUNCATE TABLE on the staging tables, as they are external tables. It will produce an error. Hive does not manage the physical data for external tables. The recommended practices is to drop the staging table and to then delete the HDFS data. This practice is demonstrated in these exercises.

%md

# Reset

paragraphs.title: A - Drop database cloudsale
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS cloudsale CASCADE;

paragraphs.title: B - Drop database cloudsale_stage
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)

DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS cloudsale_state CASCADE;

paragraphs.title: C - Delete hdfs data dirctory
paragraphs.text:
%sh

echo 'BadPass@1' | su -l denis_deng -c 'hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /tenant/cloudsale/data/*'
echo 'BadPass@1' | su -l denis_deng -c 'hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /tenant/cloudsale/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/cloudsale_stage.db'

paragraphs.title: D - Delete tmp directory
paragraphs.text:
%sh

rm -r /tmp/cloudsale
%angular
